definition: pitch-black/(fig.) to be completely in the dark
abbr. for Heilongjiang province 黑龍江|黑龙江[Hei1 long2 jiang1]
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
round/lump/ball/to roll into a ball/to gather/regiment/group/society/classifier for a lump or a soft mass: wad (of paper), ball (of wool), cloud (of smoke)

sentences.english: It was still pitch-dark when I started off from Delamu Inn.
sentences.chinese: 早上從德拉姆客棧出發時，四周還是漆黑一團。

sentences.english: It was cold and hard, and like nothing else in his black universe .
sentences.chinese: 它又冷又硬，在他漆黑一團的宇宙中它什麼也不象。

sentences.english: Provincial administration was equally black spot.
sentences.chinese: 省級行政管理同樣也是漆黑一團。

sentences.english: Huge swaths of the capital remained in darkness as a result of widespread power failures.
sentences.chinese: 由於大面積斷電，醫院的大多數地方都漆黑一團。

sentences.english: I am completely in the dark concerning their plans.
sentences.chinese: 他們的計劃在我心中還是漆黑一團。
